summary: This document is an FBI operational travel plan detailing the deployment of personnel to St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, to execute a search warrant on Little St. James Island (commonly referred to as Epstein Island). It outlines the schedule, personnel roles, and travel logistics for the operation from August 8-14, 2019.

events.title: Advance Team Travel to St. Thomas
events.description: RDT POCs and case agents travel to St. Thomas for advance planning and to swear out a warrant.

events.title: Crisis Management Team Joins Advance Team
events.description: SSA and SA from Crisis Management travel to St. Thomas to assist with RDT/ERT preparation.

events.title: Main Team Deployment to St. Thomas
events.description: 44 personnel, including ERT, Case Squad, CART, SWAT, and paramedics, travel to St. Thomas on an FBI Q400 aircraft.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant
events.description: The FBI team executes the search on Little St. James Island. An additional SA flies in to join the search team.

events.title: Search Continues
events.description: The search operation on the island continues.

events.title: Search Concludes and Team Departs
events.description: The search is anticipated to be wrapped up and the entire 51-person team departs.

keyFacts: The document is a detailed FBI operational plan for a raid on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James.
The operation involved a total of 51 personnel, with 44 traveling on a dedicated FBI Q400 aircraft.
Teams deployed included Evidence Response Teams (ERT), Case Squad, Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART), SWAT, and paramedics.
The search warrant execution was planned for August 12, 2019, with advance teams arriving as early as August 8.
The plan indicates a high level of coordination and resource allocation for this law enforcement action.
